citation.article-title: Description of Maribacter forsetii sp. nov., a marine Flavobacteriaceae isolated from North Sea water, and emended description of the genus Maribacter.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Maribacter forsetii sp. nov.
Maribacter forsetii (for.set′ti.i. N.L. gen. masc. n. forsetii, of Forseti, a god in Scandinavian mythology that lived on Helgoland, the German island from where the bacterium was isolated).
Cells are non-flagellated, Gram-negative rods 0.3–0.5 μm wide and 3.0–4.0 μm long, occurring singly or in pairs, with rounded ends.
Cells are non-motile in liquid phase, but show active gliding motility on solid surfaces.
Colonies on ZoBell 2216E agar are circular, shiny, light yellow and 1.0–3.0 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days.
Spreading occurs at the margins of the colonies; the extent of spreading is strain-dependent.
Optimal growth temperature is 25 °C; growth occurs between 4 and 32 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7.5; growth occurs at pH 5.5–8.5, but not at pH 5.0 and 9.0.
Optimal NaCl concentration for growth is 2.5 % (w/v).
Very weak growth occurs in the absence of NaCl and no growth occurs at concentrations >9 % (w/v) NaCl.
Under optimal growth conditions, the doubling time is about 3.0 h.

Esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, alkaline and acid phosphatases, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase and α-chymotrypsin activities are present, but β-glucuronidase activity is absent (API ZYM).
Trypsin activity is strain-dependent (negative for the type strain).
Alginic acid, Tween 40 and Tween 80 are hydrolysed, but agar, κ-carrageenan, ι-carrageenan, starch, gelatin, DNA, glycogen and inulin are not.

d-Glucose, d-mannose, d-fructose, d-mannitol, d-lactose, methyl-β-d-glucoside, methyl-β-d-xyloside, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, glucuronic acid, lactic acid, l-glutamic acid and l-ornithine are used as sole carbon sources, but d-arabinose, glycerol, amygdalin, acetic acid, citric acid, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-threonine and l-phenylalanine are not.
Utilization of l-serine is strain-dependent (negative for the type strain).

Acid is produced from d-glucose, d-mannose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-arabinose, d-xylose, l-fucose, cellobiose, d-lactose, amygdalin and salicin, but not from l-arabinose, l-rhamnose and melezitose (API 50 CH).
Acid production from gentiobiose is strain-dependent (positive for the type strain).
Growth occurs in the presence of kanamycin (200 μg ml−1) and tetracycline (10 μg ml−1).
Other characteristics are shown in Table 1.
The DNA G+C content is 34.2–34.4 mol%.
The type strain, KT02ds18-6T (=CIP 109504T=DSM 18668T), was isolated from North Sea surface water at station Kabeltonne (5 °11′ N; °54′ E) near the island of Helgoland, Germany.
Other reference strains are KT02ds18-4 (=CIP 109503=DSM 18666) and KT02ds18-5 (=CIP 109505=DSM 18667).
